Kate Erin Bailey, a daughter of Dianne and Philip J. Bailey of Chesire, Conn., was married yesterday to Joshua Avery Gardner, the son of Dr. Paula L. Capaldo of Middleton, Mass., and Dr. David C. Gardner of Carlsbad, Calif. The Rev. Richard Beaulieu, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Memorial Church in Cambridge, Mass. Rabbi Benjamin Rudofsky took part in the ceremony.
The couple, both 25, graduated from Boston University, where they met in a Chinese language class. They began to date later, when they were both living in Beijing.

Mrs. Gardner received a master's degree in human development and psychology from Harvard last month. She is now a research assistant at the Harvard Graduate School of Education. Her father, now retired, worked in Hong Kong for the United Parcel Service, where he was the company's business development manager for Southeast Asia. Until last month, her mother taught the fourth grade at the Willard School in Ridgewood, N.J.

Mr. Gardner owns Integrated Source Management China Ltd., a manufacturer of consumer goods in Beijing. His mother is a director at NetSearch Solutions, a recruitment agency in Andover, Mass. His father, a former chairman of the department of business and career education at Boston University, is a management consultant in Carlsbad specializing in helping companies manage staff layoffs and other corporate changes.
